intro: Camissonia micrantha, commonly known as the small-flowered camissonia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and pale blue or white. Camissonia micrantha is adapted to dry environments and is often found in coastal and inland regions with well-drained soils.
